page.notifications.verified.not_found.de: Likes, mentions, Retweets, and a whole lot more — when it comes from a verified account, you’ll find it here.
page.notifications.mentions.title: Control which conversations you’re mentioned in
page.notifications.mentions.description: Use the action menu — those three little dots on a Tweet — to untag yourself and leave a conversation.
page.messages.select_a_message_descripti: Choose from your existing conversations, start a new one, or just keep swimming.
page.settings.accessibility_display_lang: Manage how Twitter content is displayed to you.
page.settings.display.tweet: At the heart of Twitter are short messages called Tweets — just like this one — which can include photos, videos, links, text, hashtags, and mentions like @Twitter
page.settings.accessibility_description: Manage aspects of your Twitter experience such as limiting color contrast and motion.
page.settings.display_description: Manage your font size, color, and background. These settings affect all the Twitter accounts on this browser.
page.settings.languages_description: Select your preferred language for headlines, buttons, and other text from Twitter on this account. This does not change the language of the content you see in your timeline.
page.settings.data_usage_description: Limit how Twitter uses some of your network data. These settings affect all the Twitter accounts on this browser.
